content.body:
> <@kaiido:matrix.org> Since Resource-Hints [has been archived](https://github.com/w3c/resource-hints/issues/100) and now points to HTML, it's not clear to me if dynamically inserted `<link rel="prefetch">` are supposed to work or if only the ones in the initial parsing would? It [used to be](https://web.archive.org/web/20210812122804/https://w3c.github.io/resource-hints/#fetching-the-resource-hint-link) explicitly stated
> 
> > The resource hint link's [...] MAY be dynamically added to and removed from the document.
> 
> It was even [one of the use-cases](https://web.archive.org/web/20210812122804/https://w3c.github.io/resource-hints/#reactive-resource-prefetching-prefetch) in that document.
> 
> Did I just miss where the current specs would allow that? I was hoping for *allowed in body* to say something related but even looking at that I didn't find anything conclusive.

I think prefetch is missing "appropriate times to fetch and process". Maybe file a bug? Noam Rosenthal will probably fix it quickly :)
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @kaiido:matrix.org

Since Resource-Hints has been archived and now points to HTML, it's not clear to me if dynamically inserted <link rel="prefetch"> are supposed to work or if only the ones in the initial parsing would? It used to be explicitly stated

The resource hint link's [...] MAY be dynamically added to and removed from the document.

It was even one of the use-cases in that document.

Did I just miss where the current specs would allow that? I was hoping for allowed in body to say something related but even looking at that I didn't find anything conclusive.

I think prefetch is missing "appropriate times to fetch and process". Maybe file a bug? Noam Rosenthal will probably fix it quickly :)

content.body: Still lots of open issues for https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22topic%3A+link%22 sadly
